```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggalt)
library(ggtext)

GBasketballstats <- read_csv("~/LukasSports/lukassportsblog/posts/lincolnchristiangirlsbasketball/GBasketballstats.csv")

Nationalavg_csv <- read_csv("~/LukasSports/lukassportsblog/posts/lincolnchristiangirlsbasketball/Nationalavg.csv.csv")

Nationalavg_csv <- read_csv(
  "~/LukasSports/lukassportsblog/posts/lincolnchristiangirlsbasketball/Nationalavg.csv.csv"
)

# First column = team/category
category_col <- names(Nationalavg_csv)

# Convert all stats to long format
long <- Nationalavg_csv %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = -all_of(category_col),
    names_to = "Stat",
    values_to = "Value"
  )

# Plot: regular stacked bar chart
ggplot(long, aes(
  x = .data[[category_col]],
  y = Value,
  fill = Stat
)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(
    title = "Stacked Bar Chart of All Stats",
    x = category_col,
    y = "Value",
    fill = "Statistic"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5)
  )

```

```{r}
team_col <- names(Nationalavg_csv)

# Convert wide â†’ long
long <- Nationalavg_csv %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = -all_of(team_col),
    names_to = "Stat",
    values_to = "Value"
  )

# Double bar chart (side-by-side bars)
ggplot(long, aes(
  x = .data[[team_col]],
  y = Value,
  fill = .data[[team_col]]
)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge") +
  facet_wrap(~ Stat, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(
    title = "Double Bar Chart: Teams Compared Across All Stats",
    x = "Team",
    y = "Value",
    fill = "Team"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)
  )

```
